description: IC349, the Merope Nebula, isn't the subject of this picture (it just stands in the way, figuratively speaking). The subject is the other nebula (or strand of such) very close and to the right of Merope itself. I think it was, back in the day, one of the deep sky imaging challenges then went around (I think it originated from the Saguaro Astronomy Club, but I could be wrong in this). Legend has it that one very prestigious astronomical equipment manufacturer used the ability of their then flagship instrument to capture said nebula as proof of the quality of their wares (very smooth optics with top notch coatings). So the challenge for me was to do exactly the same, albeit, I must admit, not with the same flair of theirs. After all I had the lesser of the gear, by the tune of several tens of thousands of $...
title: IC349 LRGB - The Nebula within the Nebula
